summary: The Tribal Energy Fairness Act of 2025 amends the Energy Policy Act of 1992 and other relevant legislation to support tribal energy projects. It focuses on the Department of Energy's Tribal loan guarantee program, allowing the Secretary of Energy to fund financial and technical assessments for loan applications. The bill also addresses tribal involvement in grid resilience projects and provides cost-sharing exemptions for certain tribal grants under the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act. The amendments aim to increase tribal access to energy programs and funding.
